questions.question: Lucas watched 60 cars go by. 18 were black. What’s the experimental probability that the next car will be black?
In an experiment, Zara picks a marble from a bag 60 times and records the color each time. What is the experimental probability of selecting a green or blue marble?
Nina has 8 tokens. She picks them 400 times. Estimate how many of the 8 tokens are yellow.
Leo has 10 counters. He picks the counters 500 times. Estimate how many of 10 are red.
A 6-sided die is rolled 24 times. “4” comes up 6 times. What is the experimental probability of 4?
A fair die is expected to roll a “2” with probability 1/6. If you get “2” 4 times out of 18 rolls, which is more?
A jar has 4 blue, 3 red, and 3 green balls. Mia pulls out a ball 40 times (with replacement). She gets red 8 times. What is the difference between theoretical and experimental probability of red?

options.text: Saying a coin has 50% chance of heads
Knowing the chance of drawing a red ball from 5 red and 5 blue balls
Predicting the result of a die roll
Counting how many times heads came in 100 tosses

questions.question: Spinner has 3 equal parts (red, yellow, blue). Theo spins it 60 times and gets red 10 times. Which is more: theoretical or experimental probability of red?
A deck has 20 cards: 10 blue, 10 green. Liam draws (with replacement) 50 times and gets blue 30 times. Which probability is higher?
